meta.description: Language labels for the Taxonomy extension in the FRONTEND

languageKey.label: A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts. Thesauri, classification schemes, subject heading lists, taxonomies, 'folksonomies', and other types of controlled vocabulary are all examples of concept schemes. Concept schemes are also embedded in glossaries and terminologies.
A collection of concepts.
An idea or notion; a unit of thought.
Preferred Label. The property skosxl:prefLabel is used to associate an skosxl:Label with a skos:Concept. The property is analogous to skos:prefLabel.
Alternative Label. The property skosxl:altLabel is used to associate an skosxl:Label with a skos:Concept. The property is analogous to skos:altLabel.
Hidden Label. The property skosxl:hiddenLabel is used to associate an skosxl:Label with a skos:Concept. The property is analogous to skos:hiddenLabel.
notes
A special class of lexical entities.
The value of the label. Combined with the language it represents the literal form of the label.
A meaningful collection of concepts.
An ordered collection of concepts, where both the grouping and the ordering are meaningful.
A collection of concepts.
An abstract relation type denoting the relation between two things.
The label of a relation.
A short descriptive text.

Notes are used to provide information relating to SKOS concepts. There is no restriction on the nature of this information, e.g., it could be plain text, hypertext, or an image; it could be a definition, information about the scope of a concept, editorial information, or any other type of information.
One of note, changeNote, definition, editorialNote, example, historyNote, or scopeNote
value
